column3: @diapolo I'm fine with this, but it seems pretty arbitrary to me. Can you document these 'rules' somewhere? For example in doc/coding-style.md?\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4398_86fe1b864b109869659f140af07047163637a673/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te

This is the last codestyle-change commit I'm going to merge for a while.

@sipa is working on a clang-format rule to take care of this automatically, then we can do it in one go, instead of breaking everyone's patches all of the time.
@laanwj I would LOVE to see a standardized way of formatting our files! Hope @sipa is pushing this :).\n
@laanwj Is include file ordering okay or also permitted for now :-P? Yes we have importend stuff to solve, but I get nausea, when looking at such things.\n
@Diapolo Include file reordering is fine with me, doesn't generally cause conflicts and if so they're trivial to solve. But no whitespace changes for now.\n
Ideally we should also have an if/else if/else statement in here. I always wonder whether to put the } on the same line as the else, etc.\n
@laanwj Ping, would love to get this cleared up and merged.\n
